intro: Trisetaria ovata, commonly known as the oval-headed grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Trisetaria ovata typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in botany and ecology.
